intro: Heliotropium corymbosum var. grisellum, commonly known as the gray heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which are often grayish in appearance, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
